column4: hello everyone . i need to format a usb disk but when i try with fdisk /dev/sdb i get "unable to read /dev/sdb"
fdisk is not the same in ubuntu as win
i think your looking for gparted
both of what?  what is the output of fdisk -l (that is a small L)
if i ask for dmesg | tail i get  end_request: I/O error, dev sdb, sector 0 and Buffer I/O error on device sdb
i might have missed.  did you try the sudo gparted.  you did say this was usb drive?  what is current format?
yes i've tryied qtparted but it doesnt want to work. it says it has not possible to create a new partition
possibly.  i have had luck with testdisk getting back partitions if something went wrong.  it has a live CD you might want to give it a try.
there is no other way to try to force creating partition?
not that I know of if you cannot see the drive...
have you tried the drive on other PC's to ensure it works at all?
yes. it doesnt work. i've tryied also in win
sorry couldn't help more.  also could try systemrescue cd.  I use that for all my partitioning.
